stem: The possibility of water hammer in a liquid system is minimized by...

choices.A: maintaining temperature above the saturation temperature.
choices.B: starting centrifugal pumps with the casing vent valve fully open.
choices.C: starting positive displacement pumps with the discharge valve closed.
choices.D: venting systems prior to starting centrifugal pumps.

stem: Which one of the following methods will increase the possibility and/or severity of water hammer? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Opening and closing system valves slowly.
choices.B: Venting fluid systems prior to starting a pump.
choices.C: Starting a centrifugal pump with the discharge valve fully open.
choices.D: Starting a centrifugal pump with the discharge valve fully closed. -845- PWR Test Items

stem: A sudden stop of fluid flow in a piping system, due to rapid closure of an isolation valve, will most likely result in...
One reason for keeping condensate out of the steam lines is to... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: prevent water/steam hammer. -846- PWR Test Items

stem: To minimize the possibility of water hammer when initiating flow in a system, the operator should... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: vent the system prior to initiating flow.
choices.B: vent the system only after flow has been initiated.
choices.C: fully open the pump discharge valve prior to starting a pump.
choices.D: rapidly open the pump discharge valve after the pump is running. -847- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following operating practices minimizes the possibility of water hammer?

choices.A: Change valve positions as rapidly as possible.
choices.B: Start centrifugal pumps with the discharge valve throttled.
choices.C: Start positive displacement pumps with the discharge valve closed.
choices.D: Vent systems only after initiating system flow.

stem: Which one of the following will result in a higher probability and/or severity of water hammer in a flowing water system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Gradual pipe bends rather than sharp pipe bends.
choices.B: Shorter pipe lengths rather than longer pipe lengths.
choices.C: Lower initial flow rates rather than higher initial flow rates.
choices.D: Shorter valve stroke times rather than longer valve stroke times. -848- PWR Test Items

stem: An 85 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 100 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 50 psig?
Mass flow rate equals volumetric flow rate times... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A 55 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 100 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 50 psig?

A 75 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 80 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 40 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A 60 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 75 psig?

A 100 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 60 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 20 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A 100 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 45 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 30 psig?

A 47 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 75 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

An 80 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 100 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 75 psig?

A 60 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 100 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

An 80 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 75 psig?

An 80 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 100 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A 75 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 100 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 80 psig?

A heat exchanger has the following initial cooling water inlet temperature and differential pressure (ΔΡ) parameters: Inlet Temperature = 70°F Heat Exchanger ΔΡ = 10 psi Six hours later, the current heat exchanger cooling water parameters are: Inlet Temperature = 85°F Heat Exchanger ΔΡ = 10 psi In comparison to the initial cooling water mass flow rate, the current mass flow rate is... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: lower, because the density of the cooling water has decreased.
choices.B: higher, because the velocity of the cooling water has increased.
choices.C: the same, because the changes in cooling water velocity and density offset.
choices.D: the same, because the heat exchanger cooling water ΔΡ is the same. -855- PWR Test Items

stem: An 80 gpm leak to atmosphere has developed from a cooling water system that is operating at 150 psig. Which one of the following will be the approximate leak rate when system pressure has decreased to 100 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Refer to the drawing of two lengths of 6-inch diameter pipe, each containing an identical automatic isolation valve. The actual pipe lengths are proportional to their symbols in the drawing Water at 65°F is flowing at 1,000 gpm through each pipe. If isolation valves A and B instantly close, the pressure spike experienced by valve A will be __________ the pressure spike experienced by valve B; and the pressure spike will dissipate faster in the __________ length of pipe. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: less than; longer -857- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of two lengths of 16-inch diameter pipe, each containing an identical automatic isolation valve. The actual pipe lengths are proportional to their symbols in the drawing. Water is flowing at 10,000 gpm through each pipe when both isolation valves instantly close. Consider two cases: Case 1: The water temperature upstream of both valves is 65°F. Case 2: The water temperature is 65°F upstream of valve A, and 85°F upstream of valve B. For which case(s), if any, will valve A experience a pressure spike that is greater than the pressure spike at valve B? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A centrifugal water pump was returned to service after maintenance. However, the operator failed to vent the pump. Compared to normal pump operating conditions, after the pump is started the operator will see a __________ flow rate and a __________ discharge head. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Refer to the drawing of a cooling water system (see figure below). Centrifugal pump A is circulating water at 100°F. Which one of the following will cause the centrifugal pump to operate closer to a condition in which gas/vapor binding can occur? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Surge tank level is raised by 5 percent.
choices.B: Service water flow rate is decreased by 5 percent.
choices.C: The pump discharge valve is repositioned to decrease cooling water system flow rate by 5 percent.
choices.D: Makeup water containing a high concentration of total dissolved solids is added to the cooling water system. -860- PWR Test Items

stem: If a valve closure suddenly stops fluid flow, the resulting piping system pressure transient is referred to as...
The major concern with starting a main feedwater pump with downstream fluid in a saturated condition is... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: positive reactivity addition. -861- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following will increase the possibility of water hammer?

choices.A: Opening and closing system valves very slowly.
choices.B: Venting liquid systems only after initiating system flow.
choices.C: Starting centrifugal pumps with the discharge valve closed.
choices.D: Starting positive displacement pumps with the discharge valve open.

stem: The primary reason for slowly opening the discharge valve of a large motor-driven centrifugal cooling water pump after starting the pump is to minimize the... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: potential for pump cavitation. -862- PWR Test Items

stem: Cavitation in an operating pump can be caused by...
Cavitation of a centrifugal pump in an open system is indicated by __________ discharge pressure and __________ flow rate. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
Which one of the following is most likely to cause cavitation in an operating centrifugal pump?

While on surveillance rounds, an operator notices that a centrifugal pump is making a great deal of noise (like marbles rattling inside the pump casing) and the pump discharge pressure is fluctuating. This set of conditions indicates that the pump is experiencing... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
Indications of pump cavitation include abnormally _________ pump discharge pressure and abnormally _________ pump flow rate.

Cavitation is the formation of vapor bubbles in the __________ of a pump; with the subsequent collapse of the vapor bubbles in the __________ of the pump. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: volute; discharge piping -865- PWR Test Items

stem: Cavitation is the formation of vapor bubbles in the __________ pressure area of a pump followed by the __________ of these bubbles within the pump casing.
Pump cavitation occurs when vapor bubbles are formed at the eye of a pump impeller... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: because the localized flow velocity exceeds sonic velocity for the existing fluid temperature.
choices.B: because the localized pressure exceeds the vapor pressure for the existing fluid temperature.
choices.C: and enter a high pressure region of the pump where they collapse causing damaging pressure pulsations.
choices.D: and are discharged from the pump where they expand into larger bubbles causing damaging pressure pulsations. -866- PWR Test Items

stem: In an operating cooling water system with a constant water velocity, if water temperature decreases, system volumetric flow rate (gpm) will...

choices.A: remain the same, because the density of the water has not changed.
choices.B: increase, because the density of the water has increased.
choices.C: remain the same, because the water velocity has not changed.
choices.D: increase, because the viscosity of the water has increased.

stem: A cooling water system is supplying 1.0 x 106 lbm/hour of flow at 100°F. Assuming volumetric flow rate does not change, which one of the following will be the mass flow rate in the system if cooling water temperature increases to 140°F? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A reactor coolant system is supplying 1.0 x 108 lbm/hour of coolant flow at a temperature of 100°F. Assuming volumetric flow rate does not change, which one of the following is the approximate mass flow rate that will be supplied by the system if cooling water temperature increases to 400°F?

A reactor coolant system is supplying 1.0 x 108 lbm/hr of coolant flow at a temperature of 100°F. Assuming volumetric flow rate does not change, which one of the following is the approximate mass flow rate that will be supplied by the system if coolant temperature increases to 500°F? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A cooling water system is supplying 2,000 lbm/min coolant flow at a temperature of 100°F. Assuming volumetric flow rate does not change, which one of the following is the approximate mass flow rate that will be supplied by the system if cooling water temperature increases to 140°F?

The volumetric flow rate of cooling water entering a heat exchanger is 500 gpm. Given the following:  Cooling water pressure entering and leaving the heat exchanger is 10 psig.  Cooling water inlet temperature is 90°F.  Cooling water outlet temperature is 160°F.  Heat exchanger inlet and outlet piping have the same diameter. What is the approximate volumetric flow rate of the cooling water exiting the heat exchanger? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020
Operating two pumps in parallel instead of operating a single pump will result in a...

choices.A: large increase in pump head and a small increase in pump flow rate.
choices.B: small increase in pump head and a small increase in pump flow rate.
choices.C: small increase in pump head and a large increase in pump flow rate.
choices.D: large increase in pump head and a large increase in pump flow rate.

stem: The major effect of starting a second centrifugal pump in parallel with an operating centrifugal pump in an open system is increased... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: pump flow rate. -870- PWR Test Items

stem: To decrease the flow rate through an operating positive displacement pump, an operator should...

choices.A: throttle the pump discharge valve partially closed.
choices.B: throttle the pump suction valve partially closed.
choices.C: decrease the pump’s available net positive suction head.

stem: Which one of the following will decrease the head loss occurring in an operating cooling water system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Starting a second pump in parallel with the operating pump.
choices.B: Shifting two heat exchangers from parallel to series operation.
choices.C: Replacing a 10 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe.
choices.D: Replacing a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot section of 12-inch diameter pipe. -871- PWR Test Items

stem: Two centrifugal pumps and two positive displacement pumps are able to be cross-connected to provide makeup water flow to a system. Each pump will produce 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,000 psig. If system pressure is 1,200 psig, which one of the following combinations will produce the greatest flow rate to the system?

choices.A: Two positive displacement pumps in series
choices.B: Two positive displacement pumps in parallel

stem: Two centrifugal pumps and two positive displacement pumps are able to be cross-connected to provide makeup water flow to a system. Each pump will produce 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,000 psig backpressure. If system pressure is 800 psig, which one of the following combinations will produce the greatest flow rate to the system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.C: Two positive displacement pumps in parallel.
choices.D: Two positive displacement pumps in series. -872- PWR Test Items

stem: Two identical centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,000 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the lowest makeup water flow rate to the system if system pressure is 1,700 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.C: One PDP and one CP in series (CP supplying PDP)
choices.D: One PDP and one CP in parallel -873- PWR Test Items

stem: Two identical centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,000 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the highest makeup flow rate to the system if system pressure is 800 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: One PDP and one CP in series (CP supplying PDP)
choices.B: One PDP and one CP in parallel
choices.D: Two CPs in parallel -874- PWR Test Items

stem: Water at 90°F and 50 psig is flowing through a 10-inch diameter pipe at 100 lbm/sec. The pipe then splits into two pipes, a 4-inch diameter pipe and an 8-inch diameter pipe. Disregarding any flow restrictions other than pipe size, which one of the following lists the approximate flow rates through the 4-inch and 8-inch diameter pipes? (Assume that water velocity is the same in each pipe.) 4-inch Pipe 8-inch Pipe (lbm/sec) (lbm/sec) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Two identical centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,200 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the highest makeup flow rate to the system if system pressure is 500 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: One CP and one PDP in series (CP supplying PDP) -876- PWR Test Items

stem: Water at 90°F and 50 psig is flowing through a 10-inch diameter pipe at 100 lbm/sec. The pipe then splits into two pipes, a 3-inch diameter pipe and a 6-inch diameter pipe. Disregarding any flow restrictions other than pipe size, which one of the following lists the approximate flow rates through the 3-inch and 6-inch diameter pipes. (Assume that water velocity is the same in each pipe.) 3-inch Pipe 6-inch Pipe (lbm/sec) (lbm/sec) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Water at 90°F and 50 psig is flowing through a 10-inch diameter pipe at 100 lbm/sec. The pipe then splits into two pipes, a 6-inch diameter pipe and an 8-inch diameter pipe. Disregarding any flow restrictions other than pipe size, which one of the following lists the approximate flow rates through the 6-inch and 8-inch diameter pipes? (Assume that water velocity is the same in each pipe.) 6-inch Pipe 8-inch Pipe (lbm/sec) (lbm/sec) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Two identical centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,200 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the highest makeup flow rate to the cooling water system if system pressure is 1,700 psig? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: One CP and one PDP in series (CP supplying PDP) -879- PWR Test Items

stem: Two identical single-speed centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical single-speed positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,200 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Discharge pressure at shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the highest initial flow rate to a cooling water system that is drained and depressurized? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: One CP and one PDP in series (CP supplying PDP) -880- PWR Test Items

stem: Two identical single-speed centrifugal pumps (CPs) and two identical single-speed positive displacement pumps (PDPs) are able to take suction on a vented water storage tank and provide makeup water flow to a cooling water system. The pumps are capable of being cross-connected to provide multiple configurations. In single pump alignment, each pump will supply 100 gpm at a system pressure of 1,200 psig. Given the following information: Centrifugal Pumps Discharge pressure at shutoff head = 1,500 psig Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Flow rate with no backpressure = 180 gpm Positive Displacement Pumps Maximum design pressure = 2,000 psig Which one of the following pump configurations will supply the lowest initial flow rate of makeup water to a cooling water system that is drained and depressurized? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: One CP and one PDP in series (CP supplying PDP) -881- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a main water header that splits into two parallel headers (see figure below). Header A has a 2-inch diameter and header B has a 3-inch diameter. The velocity of the water in both headers is the same. If the main water header has a flow rate of 500 gpm, what is the approximate flow rate in each of the parallel headers? Header A Header B (gpm) (gpm) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A length of pipe in a cooling water system uses a reducer fitting to decrease the pipe diameter from 6 inches to 4 inches. The flow rate in the 6-inch diameter section of pipe is 200 gpm. What is the flow rate in the 4-inch diameter section of pipe?

A vented water storage tank contains 60 feet of water at 70°F. A cracked weld at the bottom of the tank results in a leak rate of 12 gpm. If makeup water flow rate is 5 gpm, at what water level will the tank stabilize? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A vented water storage tank contains 64 feet of water at 70°F. A cracked weld at the bottom of the tank results in a leak rate of 12 gpm. At what water level will the leak rate be 3 gpm? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

An ideal positive displacement pump is operating in an open system with the following initial parameters: Suction pressure = 10 psig Discharge pressure = 25 psig Flow rate = 100 gpm If the pump discharge pressure increases to 40 psig, the pump flow rate will...

choices.B: decrease in direct proportion to the change in pump differential pressure.
choices.C: decrease in direct proportion to the square of the change in pump differential pressure.
choices.D: decrease in direct proportion to the square root of the change in pump differential pressure.

stem: A centrifugal pump is operating at a constant speed in a closed system with the following initial parameters: Suction pressure = 10 psig Discharge pressure = 25 psig Pump flow rate = 500 gpm If the pump discharge flow control valve is throttled such that the pump discharge pressure increases to 40 psig, the change in pump flow rate will be... NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: directly proportional to the square of the change in pump differential pressure.
choices.B: directly proportional to the square root of the change in pump differential pressure.
choices.C: inversely proportional to the square root of the change in pump differential pressure.
choices.D: impossible to determine from the provided information. -885- PWR Test Items

stem: Which one of the following will increase the head loss occurring in an operating cooling water system?

choices.A: Shifting two heat exchangers from parallel to series operation.
choices.B: Increasing the flow rate in the system by throttling open a flow control valve.
choices.C: Replacing a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 10 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe.
choices.D: Replacing a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot section of 12-inch diameter pipe.

stem: Which one of the following changes to an operating cooling water system will decrease the head loss occurring in the system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Positioning a flow control valve more open.
choices.B: Shifting two heat exchangers from parallel to series operation.
choices.C: Replacing a 10 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe.
choices.D: Replacing a 20 foot length of 12-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe. -886- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a main water header that splits into two parallel headers (see figure below). Header A has a 2-inch diameter and header B has a 4-inch diameter. The velocity of the water in both headers is the same. If the main water header has a flow rate of 500 gpm, what is the approximate flow rate in each of the parallel headers? Header A Header B (gpm) (gpm) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

A vented water storage tank contains 30 feet of water at 70°F. A cracked weld at the bottom of the tank causes an initial leak rate of 12 gpm. If makeup water flow rate is 8 gpm, at what water level will the tank stabilize? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

Refer to the drawing of an operating cooling water system (see figure below). Which one of the following will increase the mass flow rate in the system with a corresponding increase in the total system head loss? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Shifting operating pump A to a higher speed.
choices.B: Positioning the flow control valve (FCV) more open.
choices.C: Replacing a 20 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 10 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe.
choices.D: Replacing a 20 foot length of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot length of 12-inch diameter pipe. -889- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of an operating cooling water system (see figure below). The centrifugal pump is operating with the flow control valve (FCV) fully open. If the system flow rate is decreased by partially closing the FCV, the pump differential pressure will __________; and the heat exchanger cooling water differential pressure will __________. NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

An operating centrifugal water pump has a 26-inch diameter suction nozzle and a 24-inch diameter discharge nozzle. For this pump, the discharge water velocity is __________ the suction water velocity; and the discharge water volumetric flow rate is __________ the suction water volumetric flow rate. (Assume water is incompressible and the suction and discharge water temperatures are the same.) NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.D: less than; equal to -891- PWR Test Items

stem: Refer to the drawing of a cooling water system using 10-inch diameter pipe (see figure below). Only centrifugal pump A is operating and the flow control valve (FCV) is 80 percent open. Which one of the following actions will increase the total head loss in the system? NRC Generic Fundamentals Examination Question Bank--PWR November 2020

choices.A: Increase the system flow rate by starting centrifugal pump B.
choices.B: Increase the system flow rate by opening the flow control valve more.
choices.C: Replace a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 10 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe.
choices.D: Replace a 20 foot section of 10-inch diameter pipe with a 20 foot section of 12-inch diameter pipe. -892- PWR Test Items
